intro: Hedera helix var. rhombea, commonly known as the rhomboid ivy, is a cultivar of English ivy characterized by its distinctive rhomboid-shaped leaves. It is a climbing evergreen vine native to Europe, belonging to the Araliaceae family. The plant features dark green, glossy foliage with a slightly waxy texture, and it produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers in the spring. Hedera helix var. rhombea is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded environments. It prefers moist, well-drained soil and can be grown both indoors and outdoors.
